name: Kalash Kankaria
title: Machine Learning Engineer
summary: Machine Learning Engineer passionate about rapid experimentation and production-ready AI systems. I specialize in LLM/NLP, end-to-end ML deployment, and building solutions that fail fast, learn faster, and deliver measurable impact.

highlights: Designed a unique-screen identification pipeline that clusters structurally similar webpages while remaining agnostic to instance and tabular data, auto-classifying pages in real time and eliminating screen-level noise
Delivered an Outlook-email understanding pipeline: fine-tuned open-source LLMs (Qwen, Granite, Llama, HF checkpoints) via Ollama and engineered prompts for intent mining and entity extraction
Managed end-to-end delivery from LLM setup, docker image generation for on-prem client gateway to algorithm processing, and db persistence
Implemented hierarchical, unsupervised clustering of emails by intent at several business-relevant granular levels, focusing on action verbs, domain keywords and instance details
Built a classification pipeline for segregating process and non-process related emails for enterprise clients by combining a hybrid approach (topic-modeling + One-Class SVM + rule-based NLP)
Benchmarked capabilities and limitations of commercial Large Language Models (LLMs) for large-scale synthetic-data generation to bolster downstream model training
Led training and fine-tuning of LLMs with transfer learning for event grouping and task identification
Delivered a production-grade prototype slated for client deployment

projects.name: Machine Unlearning — Forgetting Images
projects.description: Implemented, hypothesized and benchmarked multiple image based machine-unlearning algorithms (fine-tuning resets, noise-injection fast unlearning, layer re-initialisation) to unlearn a dataset, remove biased or sensitive samples from trained models, enhancing responsible practices and ethical deployment.
projects.impact: Built a biometric facial-recognition demo and evaluated unlearning strategies on real data, balancing accuracy vs. unlearning latency

projects.name: Bayesian Unlearning — Learning to Forget
projects.description: Investigated Bayesian Unlearning methods for probabilistic modeling (Laplace approximation, MCMC, variational inference, other mathematical approximations) and enabling selective data removal without full retraining.
projects.impact: Derived a closed-form unlearning update for logistic regression and explored extensions to neural networks, charting future research directions

projects.name: Reputation & Conflict Propagation in Signed Networks
projects.description: Analysed a Signed Reddit-hyperlink network to define trustworthiness scores across 86 edge attributes and formulated a hate factor per post.
projects.impact: Applied Random Forest and LSTM models on centrality-feature vectors to predict conflict propagation
